p: Only specific Abs for the head of HA efficiently prevent infection, by blocking the HA-mediated attachment to the cell surface ( 26). Anti-HA Abs can also have an effect on the activity of other influenza-related proteins. Several authors have found both in humans and mice that anti-HA Abs can also interfere with the activity of neuraminidase (NA) by blocking virus binding to the surface bound NA-substrate or by sterically inhibiting NA access to the substrates ( 30â€“ 32).
